benchmark_details.name: FEA-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: FEA-Bench is a benchmark designed to assess the ability of large language models (LLMs) to perform incremental development within code repositories, specifically focusing on the implementation of new features through a dataset derived from pull requests in 83 GitHub repositories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the repository-level incremental code development capabilities of large language models (LLMs) when implementing new features.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark includes only Python repositories and may exhibit certain limitations regarding data quality and diversity.

data.annotation: Automatically filtered and paired with unit test files for verification.

methodology.calculation: The resolved ratio is defined as the percentage of task instances for which all unit tests pass.
methodology.interpretation: A higher resolved ratio indicates better performance in successfully implementing new features.
methodology.validation: Each task instance is validated by checking the pass status of related unit tests before and after applying code changes.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data obtained from publicly available repositories with appropriate licenses.
